The plant has small, needle-like leaves that are often curved and covered in a layer of papillae, which help reduce water loss. It is known for its ability to tolerate desiccation, making it a resilient species in arid or semi-arid habitats. Oreogrammitis reinwardtii plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
